Reviews.Title: “overall good choice”
Reviews.Author: missmadison
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a great choice for a convention - being right across the street allowed us to run back during breaks, get up at the last minute, still eat breakfast and make it over there! Also brought our box lunches back one day and ate in the lovely courtyard. The lobby area is unique, breakfast was good, and plenty of tables. Wireless was good. I'd definitely recommend the historic warehouse building - stayed there a few years ago and was impressed. We were in the other tower this time and it was pretty disappointing - small room, one small window and the room was overall just quite "worn" - some peeling wallpaper here and there, scuffs on all the walls and corners. But the location and amenities for the price can't be beat! We walked to the French Quarter and it was no problem. The Sun Ray Grill nearby was also great -good food, and we actually ate there twice one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: elttik
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, the service was above average, the breakfast was good, the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Not-Your-Average Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: shortysnh
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights here. If the logos were absent, you wouldn't know it was a Hampton Inn. This chain normally has clean, comfortable, functional, but simple properties. This particular property is much more substantial in its services and decor. This renovated warehouse offers an interesting change from cookie-cutter hotels. They did a great job modernizing it without destroying its original look. The large, high ceilinged lobby is a nice place to sit and read or meet friends. Also, there wasn't obnoxiously loud music blasting, making it peaceful and relaxing. Pros: Friendly staff. Spacious and clean room, with high ceilings. Our requested rollaway waiting for us in the room. A huge breakfast area with many tables (often a problem at other hotels). A better-than-average breakfast buffet that was constantly refreshed. An on-site bar. Plentiful cabs (we didn't have a car). Nice neighborhood; despite its neat but somewhat gritty appearance, there are lots of little nooks and crannies to explore. A shower with ample water pressure and hot water, which can be problematic at older hotels in New Orleans. Upon check-in, we had to initial on the contract that we would comply with their no-smoking rules, which I appreciated, being allergic to smoke. Cons: Very few...I was surprised that since the hotel had a nice lounge, and offered in-house catering for events, they would have food service available for guests but they didn't. There were bar-and-grill places nearby for a simple meal, but were really smoky. We had a partial kitchen, (no stove or kitchen sink, but a counter, microwave, fridge and basic eating utensils), which was handy, but a serrated knife would be helpful. We had bought fruit and cheeses and found it hard to assemble a platter using what was basically a butter knife. Lastly, either there were guests who disregarded the smoking rules, or the ventilation system had issues, but several times the smell of stale smoke was in the room. If it was a guest belligerence problem, I guess the hotel can't do much about that.

Reviews.Title: “Final Four Stay”
Reviews.Author: zebra6331
Reviews.Content: First of all, you must request the old building...very cool and unique. I would not have been as happy with the regular building at Final Four Weekend prices ($329 for standard-4 night min---ouch!) Our room was spotless...grounds clean...no strange smells! Bed was awesome--14 foot high ceilings and old warehouse windows were just cool. I was scared reading reviews about NOLA hotels, but we were thrilled with Hamptonn. Just a half mile to HArrah's, and 1.2 mile walk to beginning of Bourbon Street. So, close enough to all the fun, but away from the craziness when it was time to sleep. Free breakfast was nice. Parking is $30...wish I would have just parked at garage 1 block away for $12 a day. I would like to visit NOLA again when not so crowded, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & breakfast, room was a little "tired"”
Reviews.Author: pearlgirl22
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay at this Hampton Inn again if I came to New Orleans. It is just across the street from the convention center and a short walk to Canal Street and the French Quarter. The street cars are also within a few blocks, which is convenient to go to the French Quarter or Garden District. The hotel was charming and the hot breakfast was also great. The front desk attendants and the concierge were very helpful. My only complaint is that compared to other Hampton Inns that I've stayed in, our room was a little run down. I imagine it gets a lot of turn over being just across the street from a convention center, though. All in all, I would certainly recommend this hotel. The beds were comfortable and there are too many other positives that outweigh the room condition.

Reviews.Title: “Great Variety in Breakfasts/Attractive Lobby and Bar”
Reviews.Author: Suzegal
Reviews.Content: I would probably rate this higher except for several things that bothered me. It is a very attractive building that is well kept. Breakfasts were great, something for everybody. Coffee and tea were available 24 hours. Multiple rest/meeting areas in the huge lobby. Desk staff was helpful. I found the concierge the opposite. He sat there and never made any suggestions when asked, had little knowledge of area or maybe was just lazy. I was totally unimpressed. We got more help from the desk staff. We had intended to tour as well as attend our convention. There were always taxis available. The location was the best for the convention center but far from the fun. The Convention Center was right across the street and for that reason, I would return to this hotel. There was nowhere to eat in the hotel except for microwavable and junk food. The major reason I gave this an average is that the carpet in our room was damp. The entire room was damp, actually. I hand washed a shirt that I wanted to rewear. It was a travel shirt that was supposed to dry quickly and has in the past. It took four days to dry. Now, I understand that NOLA is humid. But damp carpets and musty room were too much to bear. I will definitely ask to see the room if I ever have to return.

Reviews.Title: “POST-CRUISE STAY”
Reviews.Author: pianoplayerla
Reviews.Content: Our cruise returned to New Orleans on Thursday morning and we chose to spend the day seeing some of the city. We had made advance reservations with Hampton but our room was not ready at 10:00 a.m. The bell man tagged our bags for us so we could walk around without having to worry about our luggage. The desk clerk said she would call us when our room was ready. Gave her my cell number and within a couple of hours they called. Our room was in the "new" side of the hotel, had a view of the highway and traffic on a side street, but that was no problem. The room was very clean; comfortable king size bed; the expected Hampton Inn amenities!! Breakfast was much better than usual, oatmeal, assorted fruits, cold cereals, western omelets, sausage and hashbrowns and coffee, juice and hot tea. This hotel is right across from the convention center, a fairly easy walk to Riverwalk Mall & the cruise port. We actually walked all the way through the French Market before we hopped a ride on the street car. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely building was a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Bets54
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers exactly what you expect from Hampton Inn - reasonable prices, a nice breakfast buffet, good beds and free Internet. But it adds a good location - not in the French Quarter, not at the Superdome, but priced lower and within easy walking or cab distance of all the attractions. And unexpectedly, the lobby is lovely, there's a charming courtyard, and an attractive bar for cocktails. Our room was quite stylish with good draperies and a handsome window.

Reviews.Title: “A little walk from the French Quarter, but well worth it”
Reviews.Author: TestieTourist
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a couple of nights at this facility prior to taking a cruise out of New Orleans. While it is a 15 minute walk from the French Quarter, it is very convenient to the ship terminal. The walk is not onerous and a few hundred yards away is access to the street car line and the Riverwalk shopping area. The rooms were very comfortable and quiet and we thought reasonably priced. We can't say enough good things about the staff at the hotel. From arrival to departure they bent over backwards to accommodate us. Even though we had not booked the Cruise package, they made sure we could take the shuttle to and from the terminal, and since our return flight didn't take off till early evening, allowed us to store our bags for a few hours after we disembarked so we could see around the city. Everyone from the front desk staff to the young men who ran the baggage check were unfailingly polite and helpful. We will certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastice breakfast, run down rooms.”
Reviews.Author: PopsandMimi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located accross the street from the convention center and near the River. We stayed because of its access to the WW II museum, 4 blocks away. The hotel caters more to business than couples. Rooms are in pretty sad shape, but were clean--just small and pretty beat up. The breakfast was the best we have seen in many moons--excellent hot and cold selections. You have to pay extra for parking, and you really have no options, and that seems pretty common for New Orleans hotels (and most big cities). the valet service was included, and was very prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Savytraveller10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a King Suite at this property while on business in New Orleans. It's a small hotel. So there wasn't a lot of walking involved. The elevators were quick. And it's literally a few minutes' walk to the convention centre. The room was large and very clean. The breakfast was second to none. There was anything one could want from oatmeal to hot eggs and a meat choice each day.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat convenient, valet parking was a joke.”
Reviews.Author: SenBlack
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here. I was in town for Mardi Gras. The hotel only has valet parking. We were told it was $30. It was mot used the first night. The next night there was activity at the convention center, so we opted to use the valet parking. The next morning when trying to leave, waited 20 min before being told car keys couldn't be located.....really. Seems they were being held at the front desk for payment. After complaining we had been told valet parking would be comped for the night. Upon check out, received a bill for $40 for the night that should have been comped. The manager quickly removed, since there was a note saying it was to be comped. I can the room was nice and clean. Housekeeping was prompt after the 2nd day. They did offer a hot breakfast. Scrambled eggs not so great, but omlettes other days made up for it. Not a good location if parade is going to be rolling by. It was hard to get in/out during this time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Italo_american_11
Reviews.Content: Usual Hampton Inn value, especially for the business traveler. This was my 4th overnight stay in the NOLA tourist corridor. Spacious, clean rooms and above average Hampton Inn breakfast. This hotel is certainly a hike from the French Quarter but then again it's meant to service the convention center across the street. Parking is a costly affair as it is everyplace in the area but less of a hassle. It all depends on what you're looking for. I would definitely bring my family to this location for its' value and convenience but also since it seems far from the grit of Bourbon street but close enough for the flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay with exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: ShanH84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a convention. Convention Centre is right across the street so it was easy to get to and from our meetings. Staff was amazing from the minute we arrived, very helpful and friendly. The rooms are clean and have lots of space, with a large bathroom as well. Continental breakfast has alot of options and even a make your own waffle station which is a great idea! Not a far walk to the French Quarter (15 minutes) and shopping places. Would definitely stay here the next time I come to New Orleans!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: PrincessChipmunk
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for an event at the convention center which was directly across the street from the back entrance. Room and bathroom were very nice. Huge lobby nicely decorated with Mardi Gras decors since it was coming up. Staff was pleasant. Complimentary breakfast was ok but then again I'm spoiled since I've stayed at 5-star hotels where the breakfasts were feasts. Nice tiny pool which we unfortunately didn't use since the weather was still cold. Only thing was if you are looking to hang out a lot in the French Quarter, it's a bit of a walk. Maybe about 20mins. A little leery at night since it's located in the Warehouse District and not very many people are around. Certainly far from the Garden District and a walk from the streetcars as well. Still the best $100/night hotel I've been in though.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and convention center convenient”
Reviews.Author: Majodang
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast! Good rooms but loud heating/AC. Relaxing and comfortable lobby. Walking distance to lots of restaurants and french quarter and very conveniently located for conventions.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Excellence in Service and Value!”
Reviews.Author: ginny s
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend of January 20th, 2012. We had 3 rooms. This hotel is very well located, the staff truly understands service, and this is an exceptional value. From the time you enter until you exit every staff member is truly there to help and make your stay more enjoyable. The included breakfast with make your own waffles, fruit, yogurt, all types of cereal, oatmeal, eggs, etc.. is delicious. Everything is a few blocks away. The rooms are very nice, the beds are super comfy, rooms are very clean and spacious. A true value in New Orleans!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Karon77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live near Birmingham and wanted to spend New Year's in New Orleans so we decided to take the Amtrack Crescent Train for the weekend trip. Having done this before we rented a bedroom car and left from Anniston, AL which means about 9 hours on the train. so we could start the New Year's clebration early nap and hit New Orleans ready to go! The train arrived on time at 7:30 Dec 31. We caught a cab to the hotel--about $11. Arriving at the hotel you walk through a lovely gardened area into the lobby area which would remind you more of a Boutique hotel with the high ceilings-brick exposed walls and beautifully landscaped pool area visible from the lobby area. Even with a large crowd for the weekend_--we were quickly checked in and got into our spacious room on the 3rd floor. Everything fresh and clean with a sofa bed for us to plop our luggage on and head out on the town. This hotel is located right besdie the Convention Center and about 4 blocks from Harrahs Casino, Riverwalk & Trolleies. Got back to the room and enjoyed the kinqsize bed and quiet atmosphere since we were away from the crowds. Awoke the next morning and was pleasantly surprised by a really nice hot breakfact buffet complete with true melt in your mouth hot southern biscuits. We spent Sunday afternoon and rest of the evening out and about-the weather was great for walking (just needed better shoes). Arrived back at the hotel well into the wee hours of the morning and had to be at the train station by 7am so just caught a couple of hours of restful sleep and left the hotel to catch our 7am train back to Alabama. We needed the excercise so we walked to Bourbon Street and surrounding areas during our short stay-this hotel is perfect for those that can get around by foot. It would be less deirable for those who do not enjoy walking as you would have to take a cab or pay for parking if you bring a car - (And find parking as well). (Thus we take the train and have no car.) We would stay at this hotel again--we have also stayed at the Ritz Carlton (Superb Hotel), a couple of Bed & Breakfasts away from downtown. Overall an excellent experience. We felt safe walking and there seems to be an excellent Police presence wherever you go.The rates for the weekend were adjusted for the New Year's Holiday so it was a bit pricey but when I compared to other places to stay for the same amounts I think we came out very well!

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: LLAlexander
Reviews.Content: This hotel is basically clean and just fine. Within easy walking distance to the quarter and quiet. Just an FYI...you get what you pay for with the internet. It's slow and undependable if you aren't on a lower floor. If you do a significant amount of work on the internet you may want to bring your own source. The only actual issue I had was being woken one morning by the housekeeping staff cleaning the room next door while playing the radio and shouting across the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Jeff R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to New Orleans at least once a year, usually two or three times. We have stayed in three French Quarter hotels, two historic and one tall and modern. We have also stayed in two hotels on St. Charles. All were nice, clean and we enjoyed every stay. But last year we found the Hampton Convention Center. Every staff person from the valet working the midnight shift to the ladies keeping the breakfast Buffett full were ALL friendly and helpful. Our rooms have always been clean and ready. We LOVE the location. Just a two minute walk from the riverfront streetcar (and thus riverwalk), and from there to Canal and the Quarter or on to St. Charles streetcar. But the best part of the location is that when your New Orleans day is done, you can return to the Hampton for a great night's rest away from the bustle and noise that is New Orleans. AND you will NOT find a better hot and FREE breakfast buffett. We stayed Monday through Friday and never had the same thing twice. If you love New Orleans like we do but you also love a good night's rest in a clean hotel room, with THE friendliest staff and the BEST hot breakfast buffet, then book a room at the Hampton now!

Reviews.Title: “Finally An Awesome Hotel Experience - Forget the French Quarter!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ruoutorin
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel on Christmas Day and was greeting with an extremely friendly and helpful staff and the most delicious warm white chocolate macadamia nut cookies on the planet. The hotel was beautiful, clean and welcoming. When I read that breakfast buffet was included in the extremely reasonable price of the room I was expecting the usual cold powered eggs and boxes of cereal that I always get and was prepared to eat breakfast out every day. Boy was I wrong! They had a full hot buffet of omelets, and something called a bagel topper which was so delicious that I decided to skip Brennan's and save the money. They put eggs, cheese and bacon on half bagels and somehow they manage to keep the bagel crispy while the cheese makes the inside of the bagel soft... YUMMY!!! They have a coffee area open 24 hours where you can get fruit, different flavors or coffee and hot chocolate at no cost. There are great restaurants just blocks away from the hotel and a very dealable walking distance to the French Quarter if you're in the mood for the sleaze of Bourbon Street. The staff of the hotel was in a class of their own: courteous and professional and extremely helpful (rare qualities to be found in customer service "professionals" these days. These guys really seem to love their jobs. Special mention to a young man a check out that didn't give us his name, but arranged for late check out so we wouldn't have to hang around the airport waiting for our flight! Thank you!!!! Don't make a mistake and think the Warehouse District is too far away from the action. This hotel is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: turtlemum21
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel and we had 3 rooms in the newer tower. Adjoining double/double rooms and then a 1 bedroom suite. The doble rooms were pretty standard hotel rooms with a small fridge and microwave. Not much extra room. The suite living rooms was spacious. The bedroom has a large king bed without much space on either side of it. The kitchen had the basics but no table or chairs to eat at other than the desk or sofa. The sofa bed matress was thin and less then comfortable. The king bed was comfortable. The rooms were all a bit dated and worn but clean. Housekeeping did come by early and we were still in the room - when we left at 10am they never returned. When we got back at 9m from a day of exploring we were less than happy to find a dirty room still. The breakfast was standard hotel breakfast with a variaty of breads, cereals, eggs etc. The location is a bit of a walk from the French Quarter and other area actractions but we did walk everywhere or take the street car that did stop about 10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel. A bit far from attractions”
Reviews.Author: Sharkalark
Reviews.Content: I visited last February during one of the coldest weekends anyone could remember. This hotel was perfect for my husband who was attending a conference. It was literally across the street from the convention center. The free breakfast was great as was the room. The hotel itself was gorgeous. My only complaint was that it was quite a walk to any of the action. We arrived around 10p.m. hungry and tired. The hotel restaurant had just closed and when we asked the front desk where to go they said everything near by was closed. So it was a bit of a walk to get to any restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Suite was larger than most NYC apartments”
Reviews.Author: Kolomya
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located right across the street from the convention center, is in a lovely converted warehouse. Hence, the rooms are graced with incredibly high ceilings. Three of us occupied a suite, and there was more than enough room to spread out. Service was quite good: requests were fulfilled in minutes. The included breakfast offered many options, and was quite satisfying. Location is a fair hike from the French Quarter, but the Julia Street trolley is not too far away, along with the St. Charles Street line. The neighborhood is pretty interesting: converted warehouses into apartment buildings, art galleries, and restaurants. Speaking of which, don't miss Cochon, pork paradise, a few blocks away. A few misses: (1) our mattress was uncomfortable, and (2) we had to call the front desk a few times to get housekeeping to clean our rooms. But other than that, we recommend wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to convention center”
Reviews.Author: dkuchs
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention and this hotel was very convenient. Literally across the street. It is also definitely within walking distance to the french quarter and Harrah's Casino. We were given a very nice suite in the older building. This is definitely the better building to request. I had booked a whirlpool suite and was surprised when I got to the room that there was no whirlpool. I went back to registration and was told that there is no guarantee on the room type. Later on a manager offered us as many items as we wanted from their pantry to make up for the lack of the correct room. I had been looking forward to a whirlpool but it was not the end of the world. The breakfast here is a typical Hamptom, so not very good at all. But I am not complaining because they served the same food served at all Hamptons so I was expecting exactly what I got. The price for the room was fair. Unlike many Hamptons, this one actually has a hip bar that is open from 5-10 PM. There is also a very small pool outside. The property is actually quite charming and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kegan36604
Reviews.Content: I've been to 10 or so hotels in the downtown NOLA area (in the Quarter, CBD, Garden District, etc). This is the best I've been too (others have been good, but this one stands out). it is part of the Historic Hampton chain. Hardwood floors, 20' ceilings, brick walls, etc. The staff was great as well, from the valet on entry to checkout. Special shout-out to Meagan at the front desk. If Mgt is reading these, understand that she went above and beyond the required customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy at all!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomma73
Reviews.Content: I went to New Orleans for a weekend "girls" trip with some friends. We had only planned to stay in New Orleans for 1 night but decided to change to 2 nights. We couldn't add a room to our existing reservation as that hotel was sold out, so we decided to spend the first night at a different hotel. This was the only hotel in the same area as the other hotel that had a room so we booked it. This was not a happy experience. While we were able to check in early and the front desk staff was super nice, this is where the good experiences at this Hampton Inn stopped. While the room was clean (we had 2 double beds), the mattress on the beds was too soft and one of them kept sliding off the box spring. While the bathroom was average size, the towels were dingy and very thin. The carpet did appear to be clean and the room did not have an odor They did offer the free breakfast and I'm torn on how to review it. I've stayed at the other Hampton Inn in New Orleans and the breakfast there was much better. While this Hampton had the waffle makers, the layout of the food was awful. The food was up against one wall, in a single line, with the waffle makers at the end of the line. It got really congested. The food on the bar was not that great either. The "omelets" were the pre-packaged kind and the sausages were greasy. The waffle was good though! Overall, I would not stay at this Hampton Inn again. The positives of this hotel do not out-weigh the negatives for me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, and great service.”
Reviews.Author: ruthy01545
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 1.5 miles from the French Quarters, 15-20 minute walk. Very safe walk, you'll walk by Harrah's Casino and Hotel and by Canal Street. You'll need to walk to walk-off the pounds from all the fantastic food in NOLA. Really close to WWII museum, a must see. I spent over 4 hours there (bring tissues). Do the cooking class at NOLA School of Cooking on St. Louis Street, its fun, yummy and a good way to spend a few hours. They also have the best pralines!! The rooms were very clean, beautiful high ceilings. VERY comfortable beds. Great, hot breakfast with huge selection of waffles, hot/cold cereal, eggs, meats, fruit, pastries, coffee/tea, juice, and more!! The staff was very nice and helpful. Would stay again, and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jesska93
Reviews.Content: Great location if you're attending a conference across the street. Our rooms had tall ceilings and windows. Business centre provided for all our conference printing needs. Included hot breakfast included fresh waffles!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaKimberly
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a convention that I was attending. It was a very convenient location with a nice park across the street. Walking distance to the French quarter, canal street, Riverwalk mall. Room 416 is great for families with plenty of room, two double beds and a sleeper sofa. The hotel staff was great and very accomodating. The hotel itself is a converted mill which is very beautiful with lots of character. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great New Orleans Property!”
Reviews.Author: SharonCW
Reviews.Content: Only needed a hotel room for one night but would have loved to stay at this great property for several more! Having spent lots of time in New Orleans over the last 4 decades and having seen many of the old abandoned warehouses over the years, it's great to see what can be done when restoring these great historical properties. The hotel has all the New Orleans atmosphere one would expect. The beautiful courtyard area and pool area, along with all the exposed brick and hardwood floor interiors epitomize historic New Orleans. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The lobby area and breakfast buffet area are certainly a step above the average Hampton Inn. Although the hotel was almost booked to capacity, it was amazingly quiet. Our room had a great view of the park across the street. We will certainly stay here again for future trips to the Big Easy.

Reviews.Title: “A warehouse district gem”
Reviews.Author: sageranger
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night before a cruise departure. Picked for the location & proximity to cruiseport, and you couldn't be closer if you had business at the Convention Center either. Excellent TripAdvisor reviews confirmed our choice, and we were not disappointed! Spacious converted warehouse historic lobby made for a dramatic entrance. Desk clerk was super-friendly and informative. Room was spotless. Lobby bar was handy for a quick libation before dinner. (For dinner, try Emeril's original on Tchoupitoulas St., just a few blocks away). The breakfast bar at the Hampton was one of the most spacious we've encountered, with a full and excellent selection. Yes, the valet parking is expensive, as it is at just about any big-city, downtown hotel anywhere. For your weeklong cruise parking, the Fulton Place Parking Center, with free shuttle, is only a block away from the Hampton. Would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful base for our Jazz Fest adventure”
Reviews.Author: RaceTraveler12
Reviews.Content: Our group of four travelers stayed in a suite here at the Hampton. The building is beautiful and from the start, we felt very welcome. Our suite was spacious and we were very comfortable. The surrounding area has some restaurants and cafes and it was an easy walk to the Central Business District. The free breakfast was great and on more than one day, we enjoyed the opportunity to drink our coffee by the outdoor pool and enjoy the sunshine. The concierge was friendly and offered very good suggestions to us. I would absolutely return to this gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for value and location”
Reviews.Author: caligirlAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: On a birthday trip to New Orleans we stayed at the Hampton Inn at the convention center. I read the trip advisor reviews and was not dissapointed. The property is well kept and clean. The room was clean and spotless. The breakfast bar was very good. My only complaint is the expensive cost of the parking. It really should be free, not the $30 per night they are charging. Overall, I would choose to stay here again while visiting the Big Easy!

Reviews.Title: “Believe What You Read”
Reviews.Author: jcoates50
Reviews.Content: We booked here solely because of the outstanding Trip Advisor reviews. None of them overstated the excellence of this property! Entering the large and beautiful lobby was like entering an old movie of the days when hotels represented elegance and the lush life. It invites guests to sit and relax and visit a bit. We did manage to take time for just that after the very good breakfast the next morning. The room was nicely appointed and so clean that this somewhat obsessive clean-nik was duly pleased! The desk clerk Chris rates a 50 out of 10 stars for his friendliness, kindness, eagerness to help us in any way he could, and especially for his instruction to "go out and enjoy [his] city"! The bartender, too, was gracious and eager to help us make the most of his hometown. The bar was a lovely bonus, and the pool was a perfect way for families with children to let them burn off a little steam in the midst of a big city not really ideal for touring with children. We will return and can't wait to do so!

Reviews.Title: “We had a fine stay”
Reviews.Author: CA_Vacationer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights partly for fun and partly to attend a conference which was conveniently located at the convention center across the street. Our room was clean and had nice furnishings. We had a horrible view of a lower roof top but we weren't in the room much to care. Some other people we knew there were complaining about noise and thin walls. Our room was situated behind the elevator shaft which did produce a low muffled sound in the room but I decided we should put up with that rather than risk being moved next to noisy neighbors. I get the sense in this town, no matter what hotel, you are subject to noisy hallways and guests. Its within walking distance of the French Quarter and after a long night of taking in the libations down there people can get a little rowdy. I loved the location. Walkable to everything...French Quarter, Riverwalk, WWII museum (which was fabulous by the way), warehouse/arts district with ecclectic eateries, etc. The garden district was a short tram ride away. We hardly ever needed a taxi and we did not bother keeping a car there. No need for it unless you plan to leave the city. The lobby area of the hotel is wonderful. Big and open, apparently the building is a historic warehouse. The staff was pleasant. The breakfast was above par for a hotel of this category. Overall a nice experience. For the price and convenience of location we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Several areas should be addressed for better rating....”
Reviews.Author: Chuck61
Reviews.Content: This stay was part of a cruise package. We were excited to stay here...GREAT ratings and close to the cruise terminal. Check in was methodical and slightly time consuming. The lobby was clean and neat and the concierge was friendly and informative. Upon getting off on our floor our initial response was that the floor was uncomfortably COLD! We entered our room and were pleasantly surprised. HUGE room. LOTS of space and amenities. The room was also cold and we set the thermostat and had no more temperature problems in our room. We put away our things and headed downstairs. GREAT pool area. Very nice area and comfortable. It would have been great if the bar would have been open. It didn't open until 5pm. We changed clothes and walked down to Mulate's to eat supper which was REALLY good. We returned to the hotel after supper wanted to watch this Saturday nights football games and have a few drinks in the bar. The bar area was cold as ice as was the lobby. So uncomfortable we couldn't stand it so no drinks and headed to our room and the whole hotel was cold. We decided to watch the game in our room and found that the TV was at a right angle to both the bed AND the sitting area. There was a pole exactly in front of both the bed AND sitting area and it would have been a great place to mount the flat screen tv. The bathroom was well equipped and was clean. There was a pretty good frayed area of the carpeting where the carpet meets the bathroom tile that needed taking care of. The shuttle took us the short distance to the cruise terminal with no problems. Once arriving back at the terminal after the cruise we called to have the shuttle pick us up and return us to the hotel to pick up our car. After waiting about an hour, we never saw the shuttle so we took a taxi. The desk clerk refunded my money for the taxi and said the shuttle came to the terminal and did't see us. I don't see how we missed it.... Funny...during our cruise we met several others staying here the night before the cruise. Before I could even comment their first statement were how cold all public areas were at this hotel. I just had to wonder how management never noticed it but six separate guests did. This was by no means an inexpensive stay so I feel the short-comings hurt a little more than they would for a less expensive establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Best of old and new - but almost 25 min walk to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Janet055
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this Hampton has character and class. It's an old warehouse and great care was taken to preserve its heritage. It has high ceilings, original wood floors, and exposed ductwork. The warehouse/arts district bosts several excellent restaurants, clubs and galleries, and is close to Riverwalk and the Convention Center. But the hotel is a good 20-25 minute walk to the heart of the French Quarter -- farther to Frenchman Street. Stay here if you love great bedding, large rooms and modern bathrooms, a good full breakfast and low price, and love to walk.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Travelapple11
Reviews.Content: The outside of this building may not look particularly inviting, but the inside has a great deal of character from lobby to suite. I believe parts of the building used to be an old cotton mill. You will enjoy the character at a very reasonable price for New Orleans. Nice selection of breakfast items as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Sylsol77042
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay just far enough away from the French Quarter to be able to walk there if I wanted. This location is easy access to highway, right across from the Convention Center and Cruise Ship area. It was a nice 15 minute walk to French Quarter. Just minutes away from the Riverwalk, an indoor mall area which took you right to the Ferry Landing. Rooms were clean and updated. Parking was valet parking in covered garage. Walking distance to restaurants and Casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: motorcar1
Reviews.Content: Would recommend strongly great location and good value valet parking. Got this at 89 dollars

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, room so-so”
Reviews.Author: Maplehawk
Reviews.Content: If you are attending a convention, this location is fantastic. You are literally across the street! I spent 4 nights here. The staff were welcoming and helpful from the minute I walked in. Top marks for them. My room (465) was average. Ok size and clean but the AC was quite noisy and had a musty smell if on vent. Probably has mold in the condenser. I did find the room quiet. The main floor common areas are quite nice. Great spot for their breakfast. You can also sit and meet with colleagues or pop in for a beer or wine at the end of the day. My only recommendation would be to restrict smoking on the pool patio. I wanted to have a drink out there in the evening but the flock of smokers was a turn off. You can walk to the French Quarter in about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: khoff77
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the best value hotel I've ever stayed in. I was only in town for a night, but had i known the room would be like this I might have been tempted to stay longer! I'm not sure if I was upgraded or something, but the room was fantastic- huge, in the converted warehouse section so high ceilings in part of the room, large windows, exposed brick. It had a small kitchen area with a real fridge, microwave, sink, etc. There was also a sitting area, a giant four-poster bed, and a jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. Everything was very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Not only would I stay here again (and again, and again, and again) but I've already recommended it to friends. As other reviewers have pointed out, it is about a fifteen minute walk to the French Quarter, but I live in Europe and am used to walking so this wasn't an issue for me at all. I slept so well that I didn't make it down for breakfast in the morning, so no comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hampton inn I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Angil2000
Reviews.Content: This place had a lot of character, since it was a converted warehouse. Great price, great rooms, overall a good place. The crowd got a little loud, but I guess that's what you should expect for a Friday night in new Orleans. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Mold?”
Reviews.Author: AnnieofMD
Reviews.Content: Liked the look of this hotel--not your typical Hampton. Room had peculiar smell. Developed intense cough while staying there 2 nights, which disappeared the day after my stay. When I got home, my clothes held that odor. I suspect the room was full of mold, which may be a common problem in New Orleans. Regardless, I wonder how long it had been since the AC filter had been cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: dreamtrip07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Sept 16-18(checkout on 18th). We liked the hotel and location and the staff were awesome(and friendly!!!!). They went out of their way to make sure we received what we needed. My one complaint(and the reason I didn't give an excellent) was that there was an outdoor concert going on across the park from the hotel that was VERY loud. It actually went on from 5:45pm-3am with an intermission from 8-11pm. The vibrations from the bass could be felt the entire time the concert was going on. After going talk to the front desk around 2am, they informed my husband what was going on and said there was nothing they could do about it. If we were to stay here again, I'd ask for a room on the back side of the hotel(not facing the park).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but noisey”
Reviews.Author: HungryHatfield
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great, the staff was helpful, breakfast was a good, warm, continental, & the location was walking distance to the Riverwalk. Things to be aware of: 1. Because this hotel is in an old warehouse, it is very noisey. You hear every door open and close, people in the halls.... 2. You CAN walk to the French Quaters, but it is a pretty good hike! Look into public transportation to save some $$ to get around and see the sights. *Taking a taxi to and from the airport is cheaper for 2 people than taking the shuttle!!! That was a suprise to me!*

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: DarrylandCarol
Reviews.Content: We drove to New Orleans the last weekend in August to go out on a cruise. We reservered our room over the internet, selecting the "PARK, STAY AND GO PACKAGE". It included valet parking, which we thought was a great deal. To get to the French Quarter and Boubon St. is about a 15 to 20 minute walk. Our room was clean and comfortable and nicely appointed. We gave the hotel an excellent rating because we thought that from the room to the provided breakfast , and to the staff that we interacted with that it was all a notch above the standard Hampton Inn & Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best Hampton Inn in America”
Reviews.Author: edolvera
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world and I have to tell you that the Hampton Inn at the Convention Center in New Orleans is one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever been in. I was in room 214 which had spacious ceilings and looks like this hotel was built out of a old warehouse. The place is a delightful place to stay.. A short cab ride to the French Quarter

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to depart for a cruise.”
Reviews.Author: elige226
Reviews.Content: Our cruise, Carnival Triumph, was delayed due to the Tropical Storm Lee. The hotel offered to let us stay until 6pm for only half of the rate we paid. We chose to see more of the city and their valet service kept our bags for a gratuity. Once we returned to wait for the shuttle to depart, we were able to wait in the lobby comfortably watching tv. The ride to the port and continental breakfast was also complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms,unique apartment-style rooms,warehouse-charm!”
Reviews.Author: traveldoc40
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of four for seven nights at this hotel-what a delight! Check-in is speedy and efficient,the rooms are a revelation! Make sure you stay in the warehouse half of the hotel and get a one bed suite-the rooms are massive,with huge beds ,kitchen area,and large bathroom.Flat-screen TVs in the bedroom and the living room give a modern edge to a very nice warehouse conversion.The area has a slightly up-market,edgy feel to it but is completely safe at all hours.Taxis are at the front door at all times,and it is directly across the road from the massive convention centre.Some quality restaurants are within a few minutes walking distance,but get directions first-one warehouse looks much the same as another at night! Not much in the way of decent shopping nearby-the riverwalk shops are a disappointment and cater for the cruise ship trade,and the up-market Canal St Mall next to it( which is just opening) is very limited.Back to the hotel-a small pool (which was never busy) sits perfectly in a courtyard area next to the main lobby.Just be sure that you use the pool in the mornings,as by 2 pm the sun is off it and it sits in shade for the rest of the day.A gym sits in the basement if you are really keen-we used it on one occasion and it was fine ,with the usual array of equipment ,and towels and water etc at your disposal.Free coffee and hot chocolate are available round the clock at an area close to the main reception,aswell as cookies in the evening if you get there quickly! A small shop sells snacks and drinks,and the conscierge is both informative and helpful.Breakfast is a buffet-style affair from six to ten in the morning,with hot food and cereals etc. No gripes about this place-a very enjoyable stay,and the room rates are very fair too! Definately my choice again if I return to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot if you are cruising”
Reviews.Author: jackeo231
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right across from the convention centre. The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside but quite nice on the inside (quaint rustic charm). The staff were friendly. The only parking available is valet which is an additional cost. The hotel is not too far from the Riverwalk however, get there early as it closes early. The casino is just down the street from the hotel (we did not go there). The other end of the Riverwalk has indoor/outdoor restaurants which have amazing music and sea food (Nice atmosphere). The breakfast is excellent value however I found it overcrowded and understaffed. we had to wait as the staff we working really hard and were finding it hard to keep up.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel, WONDERFUL staff!”
Reviews.Author: JoanneSt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business, brought my husband & two year old son too. I picked this hotel due to the location to the New Orleans Convention center (right across the street), price and amenities. This hotel was great. The entire staff was so kind to us the entire trip. The included breakfast was delicious, room was clean & HUGE...we had a King Suite with a full kitchen in the Warehouse side and it was gigantic! If you stay with kids, you know you want two rooms..this is the type of hotel to stay in! It was a little noisy, due to the highway being so close...but I wouldn't have changed a thing with our stay. So much room for our entire family to be comfortable while on a work trip. The staff gave us great recommendations for places to see, food to eat, etc. We would definitely stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jegnm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely situated right at the convention center. It is within walking distance to the Riverwalk and French Quarter, though it can be a trek when it is hot. The neighborhood is pretty well lit and features many excellent restaurants. The hotel lobby is a renovated warehouse. The bar can be fairly lively. The pool is very small. If you have a car try to get the "park and go" rate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to access the Convention Center!”
Reviews.Author: Sherman64
Reviews.Content: We had a suite that was very comfortable. It has a decent kitchen area for a hotel room. The lobby and pool area was a pleasant place to relax and enjoy an afternoon cocktail..

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a better hotel!”
Reviews.Author: omeleko
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at this hotel in March 2010 for my wedding night. My mother booked the room for my husband and I and told them that it was my wedding night and if they could give me a nice room if possible. She payed for a regular room and when we arrived to the hotel that night all I had to do was get my room key from the front desk. I was still in my wedding dress so the woman at the counter smiled, told me congratulations and I was on my way up to my room. To my surprise they upgraded me to a suite!! I was blown away, Jason (my husband) also told me they let him go to the room earlier that day so he could put chocolate covered strawberries and champagne in the fridge and that they were very accommodating to him. Everything was perfect and I would stay there again and again. Also, you can't beat their wonderful breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “EMF 2011 Couple Retreat;)”
Reviews.Author: KatieLynn B
Reviews.Content: Loved it!! Perfect for Couples over 30yrs olds!! Romantic and FREE Breakfast:) Clean, Nice Staff and FREE Cooked Breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Our Room Was the Best Part..."”
Reviews.Author: Donna P
Reviews.Content: As Hampton Inns go, this has got to be one of the very best. We booked a King Studio in the warehouse section of the hotel. It was pristine, well-appointed, spacious, quiet and comfortable. The bed and linens were wonderful, and the whirlpool tub was a very welcome amenity. It was attractive with an exposed brick wall, and had a view of the park through the lovely tall windows. We felt welcome and comfortable the instant we set foot in this room. The hotel staff was smiling, tolerant and helpful. The lobby and breakfast rooms were also clean, quiet and pretty comfortable. In my opinion, the bar is way too small in relation to the size and expanse of the lobby...this makes it feel like this space is an afterthought when you go in. We were in NOLA for my husband to attend an event at the Convention Center, so the location of this hotel could not have been more convenient for that. We parked the car and left it there until we checked out, basically. I can understand the comments that it may be far from some of the sights and sounds of NOLA, but...this town has some of the most terrific cab drivers I've ever encountered. If it's too far to walk, take a cab, people! Taxi ride fares are very reasonable here--even modest. These folks know their town, they're good people, and they have the patience to survive through mardi gras tourists each and every year. Emeril's, Cochon and Rock n' Sake are all well within walking distance from this hotel, even wearing high heels. The wireless internet worked flawlessly, with no crashes. The fitness room was well-provisioned with workout machines, fluffly clean towels, fresh fruit and genuinely good-tasting cold water. We got a great deal on our huge, delightful room, too. That is one of the advantages of staying a bit away from the Quarter, I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Bitter Sweet”
Reviews.Author: cajungirl728
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel and for a VERY decent price you get a very large room, living room and bathroom. There is no room service and that is probably one of the things I didnt like and the bar doesn't open until later. It's in a good location and there is valet parking. Also, there is a pool but it's right next to the bar, so if you want to lay out by the pool in privacy...everyone in the bar and the lobby area can see you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Secure , Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: therman17404
Reviews.Content: Everything you expect from a Hampton. Clean comfortable beds, breakfast and a great downtown location. The pool is much smaller than it appears in the hotel pictures and parking can be difficult. NOTE: there is a $30.00 a day valet fee for parking. Multiple excellent eateries with in walking distance and the river-walk is across the street. Hotel is a remodeled warehouse rather unique and well executed.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!”
Reviews.Author: rashad1030
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, courteous and helpful staff. Close to convention center, casino and riverwalk. Will stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but a bit out of the way from the Main attractions”
Reviews.Author: mcarole411
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. Roosevelt the doorman/valet is such a character! If you're attending activities at the Convention Center, this hotel is perfect as it is literally across the street. But, for the regular 'touristy' attractions, this hotel might not be the best choice. (There is a trolley stop within walking distance)

Reviews.Title: “Close, but not quite there”
Reviews.Author: tazcaly
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful and if you want to be close to the convention center there is no better location. But...parking is expensive and only valet. The valet staff was a little indifferent. No restaurant in the hotel and none nearby so you are hiking or cabbing to every place. Rooms were okay sized and comfortable. The hotel provides breakfast but with the area was very crowded. Last day I didn't even bother. If you are there for the convention center, you'll probably be happy but if you want to see New Orleans, stay closer to the French Quarter or in the Garden District.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly employees”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily93
Reviews.Content: I was greeted by friendly front desk staff who offered fresh baked cookies upon my arrival. Cold water was always available in the lobby, and the breakfast was tasty. The common areas and my room were very clean, and facilities attended to an AC concern right away. This was an excellent location for attending a convention and it was an easy taxi ride to the French Quarter. As a solo female traveler, I was very concerned about safety, but the front desk staff provided helpful advice and patiently answered all my questions. Will definitely return to this hotel for the next convention in NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Best for Conventioneers”
Reviews.Author: Jean1922
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and right across from the convention center. The best part was the breakfast which included in the price and they give you a coupon for reduced drinks. At the breakfast buffet there were several hot dishes that really tasted home made. What was even better was that if you needed a break (or snack) you could go back to the hotel which always had coffee/tea available in the lobby and grab a piece of fresh fruit to go.

Reviews.Title: “Well, I was gonna stay several days, but then....”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTrvlr2
Reviews.Content: After speaking with hotel desk personnel and telling her about $59-$79 reduced-rate flyer card I'd been given at New Orleans Welcome Center, Charlene (I think that was her name), who was extremely nice and friendly and stated she works front desk, told me, yes, she could and would honor the card, but I'd need to present it at same-day check-in. I told her ok,I was heading that way right then, and would be there within an hour. Expecting to meet the kind, friendly, professional, and customer-focused person I'd spoken with over phone, that was not to be. Upon arriving, there was one person working check-in/service desk and I witnessed him being rude, curt/short, and dismissive with three different guests--1 wanted to know whereabouts of 'the cookies', another asked about food that was supposed to be out, a third had room-key issues. One of the guest mumbled to me that she knew he would do something like that and how hateful that little man is'. I turned to leave then thought better of it and proceeded to desk. The desk personnel ignored me initially until about my third 'excuse me, please'. Then he almost snapped with response. I told him about telephone conversation and instructions from charlene(?). He flat out told me there was no way anyone told me that because the rate was unbelievable and the rooms go for much higher. Taken aback, asked him if he was calling me a liar. He repeated himself. I sternly told him don't call me a liar. He began going on about the hotel being 90% sold out, and that the rooms go for much higher than what's on flyer card. I told him I don't need toknow all that--that has nothing to do with the reason I was there and that he was rude and nasty and that I'd driven over 600 miles to visit the city and showing up at his check in desk to tell a lie wasn't the reason for the visit. I told him he had some nerve calling me a liar when I'm a potential guest and he doesn't know me and that was very poor customer service, he was very unprofessional and rude. He backed all the way down at that point and even said he was sure 'she' quoted me that price but that 'she' should not have. Just saying there was no longer any availability for that promotional would have suffice. Yet, he took the opportunity--and from what I witnessed as I stood waiting my turn, every opportunity--to be rude, nasty, and unnecessary. As the passer-by guest said, hateful, and I'll add to that, condescending. If he didn't have a room in that price range, he should have just stated that. However, it boiled down to not only did he not want to honor the flyer-card, he didn't want anyone else to honor it either. I would have totally understood if I'd been told the room rate was no longer available. Because I was so hot and tired, I'd planned to check in at any rate. Needless to say, after giving him a quiet piece of my mind, we left and found very fine lodging and great customer service at neighboring superior property. I guess one gets what one pays for, because that Hampton Inns & Suites Convention Center New Orleans 'desk clerk' demeanor, behavior, and customer NO-service mannerism was low-rated cheap. He is a detriment as one's first impression of any Hampton Inn. .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay while visiting for business and/or pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: ibvic
Reviews.Content: This property is clean and located with walking distance of everything. Catch a ride to the Super Dome and arena. The breakfast is very fresh for a good time period. Hotel lobby is spacious and the front desk is ample to accommodate a large number of guest. Guest Room was very spacious and extremely comfortable. Despite the celebrations on the guestroom floors the rooms were very quiet. The kids enjoyed the pool and the warm cookies at the front desk. The valet appeared to be very concerned and cautious when handling my vehicle (glad of that). The hotel staff was really good and helpful. Quite a number of smiles behind that desk and in that lobby. You really want to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight for Cruisers”
Reviews.Author: Rick-Rozzi
Reviews.Content: We took a 7 Day Cruise out of New Orleans and needed a place to stay overnight. This hotel offered great rates, with clean rooms, breakfast, nice pooll, good location to Port and French Quarter. Past Trip advisor reports help us make our decisions to stay here and we were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise and Stay was the best!!”
Reviews.Author: electric124
Reviews.Content: We booked the cruise and stay package and are so glad we did. The suite (which was the only room available for the package) was fantastic. The hotel doesnt look like much from the exterior, but the inside more than makes up for any doubts one might have. From the front desk to the breakfast everything exceeded our expectations. And the bed, was the best nights sleep me and my wife had all vacation. I originally booked the room because it was the only hotel that had a shuttle service to the cruise terminal. We got dropped off right at the terminal and were picked up promptly when we returned. I can say that the walk down the street was not as long as i originally thought and we made the trip to Harrahs and the French quarter twice on the day we stayed. Look forward to staying at this location next time we are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: loves2tri
Reviews.Content: They are not kidding when they say, "this is not your typical Hampton Inn." I have stayed at 4 & 5 star resorts and I have to say - this hotel room itself was nicer than my hotel room in Puerto Rico and the French Quarter style courtyard/pool area is very relaxing at night. It is a historic building and the remodel on it is modern and casually elegant, they left the brick facades in the main areas and it really looks great. The room was oversized, in my opinion and nicely appointed with a chair and couch in addition to the workspace area and kitchenette with dishes.The exercise room is a dream come true for people that like to stay in shape on the road: free weights, 4 different medicine balls, 3 different swiss balls, various cardio equipment, weight machines, etc. They put a great variety into a modestly small area. Staff was ok; the valet process (not the staff) and the day time manager were less than pleasant. We had issues because of the vehicle we were driving - 99.9% of most people do not show up with a trailer, so please don't let my disappointment here sway your judgement at all. Also, it is withing walking distance to the French Quarter, but it is over a mile. We are active people, so it did not bother us at all, but if you are traveling for pleasure - with grandparents and children - you might want to use your car or take a bus.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: MizzBrat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a short trip to New Orleans on our way to Destin, FL. From the moment we got there, we were helped with everything. The valets were super courteous, iced lemon water awaited us to cool us from the summer heat along with fresh cookies. The rooms were clean, and spacious. We had the front desk call for us a cab and took it to the French Quarter which was $8 (we took one both ways) And after the hurricanes and hand grenades :) decided to order pizza to the room. The front desk had an entire packet of places to order from and were super helpful. Next time we stay in New Orleans, we are definitely staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very different feel in this reconstructed warehouse”
Reviews.Author: KWLV
Reviews.Content: Great building. Rooms were expansive and nicely decorated. A healthy 1 mile walk to FQ, which was adventuresome in 90 degree weather. Would definitely return but will drive to FQ next time!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful and inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: LadyGold
Reviews.Content: Across the street from the convention center - but not easy to find. We ended up on the bridge across the Mississippi. We turned around and had to pay a toll to get back. There are lots of narrow one-way streets in the area. Valet parking is not cheap (about $30) but our total cost including it and taxes was only $120 since we got an AARP discount. Considering the quality and location it was definitely a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Above average Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: dweebe
Reviews.Content: As a HHonors member I've stayed at a number of different Hilton family properties in the New Orleans area and feel that this is one of the best, especially for the price. The rooms are pretty standard Hampton Inn. The flat panel HDTV was nice and about half of the channels were Hi Def which is still uncommon. The only downside was the carpet needed a good steam cleaning as all of our socks were quickly dirty after walking around. And the window baseboard A/C units were noisier than average. The staff was very helpful. Every interaction with housekeeping, front desk and other staff was pleasant. The breakfast buffet was pretty standard Hampton Inn but the staff works hard at maintaining everything. Even when completely slammed on a weekend morning they keep everything stocked. Plus they don't pull everything back at exactly 10:00:01 AM which other properties do. The lobby and public areas have extra character as the hotel retained the original feel of the buildings. The hotel has 5 elevators spread around so there is rarely a wait. Some of the other Hilton family hotels in New Orleans have a real problem at high traffic times that result in 2-3+ minute waits for a car. The $30/night valet parking fee is pretty awfully steep for this part of the city. Iâ€™d understand this charge in the CBD, during Mardi Gras and/or big conventions. Itâ€™s a bummer that they canâ€™t adjust it with demand or offer a cheaper self-park option. One of the nights there was an outdoor concert at the â€œSugar Millsâ€� venue which went until almost 2:30am. This is one block away from the hotel and all the rooms facing the park were treated to loud music until early in the morning. Iâ€™d recommend checking with the hotel staff if there is an upcoming show and securing a room not facing that way. Despite a few bumps, the Hampton Inn-Convention Center is on my short list of New Orleans hotels.

Reviews.Title: “In a Class of It's Own!”
Reviews.Author: asader83
Reviews.Content: Like a previous reviewer stated, I also travel 100% for work and have been a Diamond Hilton Honors member for quite some time, so I've seen a LOT of Hamptons. This particular Hampton is the coolest and most different than not just the other Hamptons, but than all the Hilton chain properties I've visited. The hotel is a retrofit of an old cotton factory and you can tell they tried very hard to keep as much original structure as possible. The lobby has high ceilings, exposed brick walls and exposed beams. Off the main registration area, you'll find a very spacious breakfast/seating/TV room, as well as a bar / lounge and the concierge desk. The lobby has two separate exits into the coutyard pool area, which is very quaint and comfortable, with 4 or 5 tables and a few loungers. We stayed in a jr. suite on the 5th floor above the lobby (there is a different building with rooms as well that looks like a newer structure, so I can't speak to the rooms there). Our room was enormous. We had a corner room that was, in the most descriptive word possible, long. Walked in to a small foyer, with a nearly full kitchen (microwave, stovetop, dishwasher, cofee pot and refrigerator) as well as a breakfast bar with chairs and a cabinet full of table settings and cookware. A living room was off the kitchen, which has a gorgeous 42 or 47" LG flat screen TV, and a large, comfortable sofa and chair. Down the hallway was a large vanity area with actual pull out drawers and under-the-sink storage (awesome for a girl and her beauty gear!), and a separate bathroom for the toilet and shower. Our particular suite was 2 beds, and my only teeny tiny gripe was these are definitely doubles / full size beds, not queens. Since I was traveling with my guy, it was a tight squeeze in a double. Maybe im just spoiled with my king at home and usual choice of a king in my hotel rooms. The bedroom area also had a large work desk, huge, vaulted ceilings and an armoire with another large LG flat screen television. In terms of getting around, we paid $20/person each way to get to/from MSY on an airport shuttle (look for the people in the yellow shirts at the airport), and they got us to and from MSY in less than 30 minutes. Since we didn't have a car, we did not have to pay the parking fee, so I guess we saved a ton there. We mostly walked into and back from the French Quarter, and it is a bit of a walk, about 15 minutes or so. But the weather was gorgeous while we were there and the walk was comfortable and interesting. On the few occasions we took a cab into the Quarter, we paid about $7. Overall, I loved this property and would not hesitate to recommend it others. We even extended our stay by a night and were offered a fantastic rate to do so, which saved us from having to pack up and move hotels. If you're still questioning where to stay, pick this place. From a road warrior, it's a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and characterful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ds23pallas
Reviews.Content: We stopped at New Orleans on a week long road trip across the USA and were looking for somewhere reasonably priced and conveniently located in the city to spend a night. The Hampton Inn is located opposite the Convention Centre and is easily found from the I10. The location was very safe and we didn't feel in any danger walking around it. It is situated halfway between the garden district and the french quarter so very convenient for the tourist attractions. The New Orleans streetcar stops just around the corner from the hotel and a taxi cost us $8 to the french quarter. The hotel is also within walking distance of the excellent Mardi Gras World - well worth a visit if you're in the city. There are two Starbucks within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. The hotel itself is a converted warehouse and retains many of the original warehouse features, such as hardwood floors and brick walls. It is in stark contrast to some of the other Hampton Inns we've stayed in in the USA - this one actually feels like a hotel! Our room was large and very comfortable and, being located a distance from Bourbon Street, it was quiet so we slept very well. Free Wifi internet access was included, as was a basic continental breakfast. The only real negative was the $30 valet parking charge, but this was to be expected given the downtown location of the hotel. There was no self parking at the time of our visit. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a cost-effective stay in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character”
Reviews.Author: mikeyroll
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice. Once was a girl's trip and the last time was with my boyfriend. The hotel is a refurbished warehouse. It is very cozy and comfortable inside. I love the original, scratched up, factory floors in the lobby. There are multiple cute little seating areas in the lobby. We stayed in a suite on our last trip and it was really nice. It had brick walls, huge windows, and lots of room. It was like a loft apartment. This place is a great deal for what you get. It is unique and charming not just a bland chain hotel room. I love staying in this area because they are lots of neat little bars around. It is a bit of a hike from the French Quarter though. They also have a decent free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “best hampton inn i ever stayed at and i've been to them all”
Reviews.Author: nfrasercolumbia
Reviews.Content: i stay at hampton inn's across the country for work. usually they are your average business hotel with few frills. the convention center is the nicest i've stayed at. the rooms were huge, and had a small kitchen, etc. only bad thing was they didn't have room service and i think all convention hotels should have room service. i got in late and walked over to the casino about 15 minute walk, not scary but i took a taxi home for safety around midnight on a monday night. new orleans is a dangerous city so you have to be careful. i also paid only $79 for the room which is amazing. i'll stay here again and again as long as those rates are around. great deal, great night sleep (super comfortable mattress). the valet was really fast also.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a Good location”
Reviews.Author: stilla
Reviews.Content: First, let me start with the three complaints I had about my stay: 1) I found hairs in my 'clean' towels; 2) the walls were quite thin as you can clearly hear conversations from neighboring rooms and from the hallway; 3) I got misinformed advice from the concierge. The first two points were annoying but the third point made me mad. I asked the concierge if there was a cemetery accessible by trolley. He politely pulled out a map and went through the route with me. Armed with my map, I and my extended family, including pre-teens, set off. After some time walking and dealing with crowded trolleys, we arrived at the LaFayette cemetery only to find that it was closed on Sundays--all day Sunday. it's not like we missed the open hours; they were not open at all that day and the concierge, whose job it is to help tourist with these things, should have known and should have told me. That aside, my experience was very good. The room itself was comfortable enough. And although there was a constant line at the front desk, the front desk staff was always friendly. The hotel lobby is unique with its old brick walls. In the lobby the staff provides much needed chilled water and has many comfortable sitting arrangements. The breakfast provided at the hotel was great: waffles, cereal, yogurt, fruit. Coffee is provided all day. The hotel location was very convenient. Right across the street from a grassy park and just walking minutes away from the Riverwalk, Starbucks, and great restaurants (like Mulates). It's also about a 30 minute walk to the French Quarter and about a 20 minute walk to the St. Charles Street trolley stop or Harrah's casino. Being directly across the street from the Convention Center, the immediate area was filled with convention goers on weekdays and relatively empty during the weekend. It appeared safe enough for New Orleans (although some ladies I met at the hotel told me their family's car was broken into while parked for the week at the hotel's secured parking lot...it is New Orleans.) In all, a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: primediver
Reviews.Content: Lobby is a renovated cotton warehouse that sets it off from you normal Hampton. Old wood floors and brick interior. Large lobby and breakfast area with the normal Hammpton fare. Rooms are what you expect from them. Nice location but a good walk to Canal St. Parking is expensive, $30.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a special place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: king4397
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I did a road trip for her spring break. Somehow...we ended up in New Orleans (the day after Mardi Gras!!!)! We looked at a few hotels on tripadvisor and definitely felt that the Hampton Inn and Suites New Orleans was worth checking out! Boy...am I glad we did! The hotel was built in an old cotton factory and the hotel was so charming! The lobby was huge and decorated for Mardi Gras! The desk clerk was very helpful in offering options for dinner and there are many restaurants that deliver to the hotel as well. The hotel room was beautiful! We had two beds and the room was huge! There were steps for getting in to the beds...and once you were in you didn't want to get out! A portion of the ceilings were 20 feet tall. The water pressure in the shower was awesome! It was immaculately clean... The location was a little difficult to get to with one way streets...but after a pass or two we got there! There is a beautiful park directly across from the hotel. It is walking distance to the convention center. We took advantage of the valet parking (not inexpensive). It is also close to Harrah's and not far from the French Quarter (although we drove). There is a bar off the lobby which was very convenient. I have to say the Hurricane that I ordered was strong but not a good Hurricane! Breakfast was available...the only complaint there is that they started cleaning up prior to 10:00. The pool is visible from the bar in a little courtyard and looked very inviting! We enjoyed the one night so much that we added a second night! All of the staff members were wonderful! I'd certainly return! The location is far enough from but close enough to the "excitement" of New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Three terrific days and nights in NOLA at the Hampton Inn! Was never disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelertrainer
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for the first time since 1976, when my boyfriend at the time and I attended Mardi Gras and he got arrested. Back then we were young, broke, and camped out somewhere on the outskirts of the city. This time I had the great fortune of attending a conference (TESOL) and staying at the Hampton Inn. I'm so happy to report that this was one of the best experiences I've had with the chain. Everything worked out perfectly. Room was great, and I loved the breakfast, the fact I could do wash in the basement, and the location was extremely convenient, both for the conference center as well as for getting to the French Quarter. It was about a 20 min walk to the heart of the action, and less of a walk to the street cars and Riverwalk. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, charming hotel, not your usual chain lobby”
Reviews.Author: mutmut3
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! Great value, great location, charming (not what you think of when you think of a chain) The breakfast was really good, lots of choices. Lounge/lobby very tastefully decorated with atmosphere. The hotel is in the Warehouse District, very charming, nice landscaping, great restaurants nearby. Low key compared to the French Quarter but with lots of excellent dining choices nearby. Very convenient to the conference center--3 minutes if you have to wait to cross the street. The only complaint was that on one day it took 2 phone calls to get the room made up--and this was at 3 pm.--housekeeping hadn't shown up all day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: JoeMSP
Reviews.Content: My parents and I spent three nights here in February, 2011, and we would gladly return. Like many others, we were in New Orleans for Mardi Gras, and chose this hotel only because prices at hotels closer to the French Quarter were too high. This hotel's staff were all very friendly, and tried hard to make our stay nice. Our room was in the newer part of the hotel, and it was very clean and spacious. The advantage of staying here, rather than in the French Quarter, is that the area around the hotel is much quieter than the Quarter is, so we did not have our sleep disturbed by drunken revelry outside the hotel. This hotel is only about a fifteen minute walk from the Quarter, so we were easily able to walk to the Quarter to see the Mardi Gras parades, or eat dinner. There were enough pedestrians out at night that we had no problem walking back to our hotel at 10 PM. We also took two walking tours of New Orleans, one of the Garden District and one of the French Quarter, sponsored by Historic New Orleans. We really enjoyed both tours, and highly recommend them to anyone who wants to learn more about the history of New Orleans. Historic New Orleans' website is www.tourneworleans.com. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be close to the French Quarter, but doesn't want to pay French Quarter hotel prices, or listen to noise from partyers all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Maikolo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with an old, charming, southern feel to the decor. Across the street from the convention center and very close to the cruise ship docks and Riverwalk Mall. The location of this hotel is about a mile and a half from bourbon street. There is a nice park across the street if you have any pets or a nice little picnic.
