Great service and free HOT BREAKFAST (Waffle maker too)! They also have a laundry mat where you can do your own laundry. Can't go wrong with this hotel. No frills, but a good hotel none the less. Oh yeah, rooms also have a refrigerator and microwave. no safe in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but was double charged for Valet Parking, and got no return call when called Manager.”
Reviews.Author: texyellowrose66
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and very clean. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. But the getting double charged for Valet parking and not call back from the Manager makes this hotel not a good choice to stay at. We only had an issue with one Valet Staff that was very rude, he told us to go park our own car and that they would find it later and re park it. My husband nicely explained to him " Excuse me we are paying for Valet Parking and it's your job to park our car", needless to say he told us to park it in front of the hotel and he would park it for us. But to our suprise when we got home and check with our bank we got charged twice for Valet Parking. When I called the hotel thisafternoon, I was told I could leave a message for the mananger, I was told his name as Manny that was at 1:40pm (CT), I left a detailed message with our confirmation number, our phone number the issue I was calling about and yes I am still waiting for a call back. I am disappointed, we travel alot, being a Military family and we always choose to stay at Hampton Inns for their outstanding service and clean hotels, now we will be wondering if we should choose a continue to use Hampton Inns or not.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toronto_Traveller88
Reviews.Content: We changed our hotel to this one after I saw the good reviews about it. I am happy that I did this, as the hotel was located exactly across the street from the convention center where the AAD meeting was held. This was the closest hotel to the convention. As for the rooms it was quite spacious and clean and we had breakfast included in the rate as well. The hotel used to be a warehouse long time ago and it was converted to hotel and renovated beautifully. The hotel was in 20 minutes walking distance from the French quarter (Bourbone St.). Anyhow I strongly recommend this hotel to anybody visiting New Orleans and especially for those that have a meeting in the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Clean Hotel with very Professional Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: vidtrans
Reviews.Content: Good hotel at a reasonable price. Very good free breakfast buffet.Parking is very expensive .We parked free for three days on the street about 100 feet away from front door.saved about $55.00.Be careful to check for parking signs.Approx. 15-20 minute walk to french quarter.Very safe large well lit street. There may be some cheap buses but in good weather it's a pleasant walk.It's usually better to not use the car.Parking and traffic may be difficult in the french quarter. The hotel is made up of two sections.The older part which I beleive was a factory.High ceilings old brick walls with a lot of character.The other side is modern and probably cheaper but very functional.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Carnival Triumph cruisers”
Reviews.Author: dixiechickola
Reviews.Content: If you're going out of New Orleans on the Carnival Triumph and need only a one night hotel stay before your cruise, this is a good choice. Their park/cruise program is convenient, since traffic and construction around the port of New Orleans is miserable. The hotel has pretty common areas and a good complimentary breakfast-lots of hot foods choices. We crammed four immediate adult family members into a standard double/double--not ideal, but it was what we got for the park/cruise deal, and for one night it was tolerable. Our room was not one of the updated ones, so if that's important to you I'd ask at the front desk. It's a 20-minute walk to the French Quarter, fine for the daytime but more sketchy at night (we took a cab.) On embarkation day the shuttle van picks you up in front of the hotel and drops you at the front door of the cruise terminal. On debarkation, all you have to do is make a phone call once you clear Customs, and the shuttles picks you up at the same spot in front of the cruise terminal. If you want to spend more time in the Quarter or have more than a one-night stay I'd choose a hotel closer to or in the Quarter--but overall, a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: Disneylovers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a Catholic Youth Minister's Conference. Great location (the outside looks like it was an old brick factory building) - right across the street from the Convention Center - we were able to walk out of the brisk weather and into one end of the Convention Center in order to reach Halls A or B. Complimentary breakfast was satisfying with lots of hot/cold choices. It was also great that coffee was available all day, so at the end of one day I grabbed some coffee before sitting down at the hotel bar (they give a 2-1 drink coupon) and added some Kahlua for a nice wind-down. Business center was convenient for immediate internet access and printing (although only 1 of the 2 computers was working, I never had to wait). The king-size room was comfy, especially at the end of a day of a conferences and seeing at the sights of "Na Orlens."

Reviews.Title: “Great value in near the convention center.”
Reviews.Author: lisalmusso
Reviews.Content: This hotel is usually a great value. I have stayed there MANY times over the past 10 years. The suites are large and have great features like exposed brick. I have one recommendation....ask to stay in the main building. The main (lobby) building has rooms that are larger with tremendous character. They also have 4 poster beds and exposed brick. The "newer building" has rooms that look like a typical hampton. They are nothing special. This is a very enjoyable stay with a staff that goes out of the way to please you. I know most of them by name! I am a local to New Orleans and this hotel is recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: whereisdave
Reviews.Content: I was seeing Jimmy Buffett at Generations Hall, so wanted a location near that- it was less than a 5 minute walk away. About a 15min walk to the trolley, which was then just a few minutes away from the French Quarter and Cafe du Mond, or it was still close enough to walk as well. But far enough away from the French Quarter craziness, quiet area. Literally across the street from the COnvention Center and right near the cruise port. Service at the front desk was friendly enough. I had to leave too early in the morning to try out the free breakfast. Free wifi worked fine. $33 taxi ride from the airport, about 20 minutes. Rooms are not brand new but are clean and comfortable. I paid about $90 for one Sunday night.

Reviews.Title: “10 out of 10 ... ! Location, Service, amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: furrydandy
Reviews.Content: Situated in a old cotton mill this Hampton Inn is truly a Hotel with historical charm...... After a 6h ride we arrived to check in and it seemed that something went wrong with the booking. There was a convention going on and the Hotel was pretty full. The staff at the reception did their most outer best to solve this problem and gave us the William's Suite #513 without any extra charge. It all was handled professional and without fuzz. The suite was simply amazing its situated in the old cotton mill building. A Ã¼ber spacious suite room with huge window, lounge area full compact kitchenette ( dishwasher, microwave, fridge, ...... ) a truly comfy huge bed, 2 TV sets , fluffy towels nice clean bathroom. We truly where wowed ! During our whole stay we where treated like VIP. The Hotel is well maintained , there is free WIFI ... in the afternoon delish free cookies at the reception. Hot complete breakfast ( too bad they use environmental unfriendly disposable cups/plates/knifes forks etc etc ..) I must say even if it is a 3 star class Hotel is sure has a 4* feel to it .... It situated close to all major touristic attraction, plenty of good restaurants in the neighborhood. Parking is a bit a B**ch either wallet parking for 27$ a day or with some luck on the surrounding street.... We truly will come back again to this Hampton Inn when we are back in New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Hampton”
Reviews.Author: gbsinkers
Reviews.Content: This hotel was once an old cotton mill in the warehouse district. It's conversion to a hotel kept the old floors and brick walls which gives it plenty of character. Our room was huge, clean and had a high 4 post king bed that included a step stool to get up into it. Definitely the nicest Hampton we've ever stayed at. Twelve foot high windows appear to be original to the building giving it a unique feel and plenty of light. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was typical Hampton Inn fare which I enjoy. My wife used the fitness center in the basement and said it was really nice. It's location is on a quiet end of the warehouse district so not a l lot to do in the immediate area but we walked a few blocks (with directions from the helpful bellman) and found plenty of good places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay before our Cruise”
Reviews.Author: IL4
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this property before our cruise on the Carnival Triumph. We stayed here as we are Hilton Honors members and the hotel offered a very reasonable park-and-stay pre-cruise package. We were able to leave our car at the hotel in a covered and secure parking lot for $10/night during our cruise and they provided a free shuttle to the port before and after our cruise. The hotel property was very nice as it has been built in a converted warehouse building. The lobby, bar and breakfast areas were spacious and beautifully decorated. The front desk staff were very efficient and pleasant. The valet staff provided exceptional service especially Thomas! Our room included a king-size bed, sleeper sofa, refrigerator and microwave. The room was very comfortable and clean. We enjoyed the hotel pool and courtyard area as it was a great place to relax after a busy day in New Orlreans. The hotel is located direcly across from the Convention Center and near several restaurants. The hotel is approximately 1 mile to the French Quarter and we walked to and from the Quarter twice during our visit. You can also take the Riverfront Trolley on Julia Street to French Quarter; however, the wait for the trolley sometimes was over 30 minutes and we just decided it was easier to walk. When we return to New Orleans, we will definitely stay at this hotel as it truly was a hidden gem in this city!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: maglasm
Reviews.Content: I've been to New Orleans in the past, and I was a little concerned that being so close to the convention center might mean a noisy, less than restful stay. I arrived in the evening, pulled right up to the valet stand (no self parking onsite) and was greeted without delay. Check in was quick and efficient. I received my keys, internet access code and a BOGO coupon for a cocktail in the bar, and headed up to my room. I opened the door and immediately thought I was in the wrong room. I opened into an entry with a full kitchen to the left, a dining area straight ahead, living room to the left beyond the kitchen. The bedroom was beyond the dining area, behind french doors. I opened the doors to the bedroom and was greeted with gorgeous floor to ceiling windows that ran along the wall. It was stunning. The king-size bed was very high, with a small step-stool next to it (which was great, I never could have climbed into bed without). I went back down to the desk to verify I was supposed to be in that room, as I was only paying $79 per night. I was told that was my room and that was the rate I was being charged. I happily returned to my room and tucked in for the night. The room was dark, cool and quiet when I scaled the bed and turned off the lights. The bed was very comfortable, my only concern was missing the steps when I got out of bed in the morning. The hotel is a converted warehouse and is very well done. There is still alot of charm, but there are also great amenities. Oh, that coupon for the BOGO drink in the bar I received on check in...there were no restrictions on what I selected. I could get beer, wine, a mixed drink, whatever I wanted. I got BOGO Woodford Reserve...and the price for the first wasn't jacked up to compensate for the free one. The staff (with the exception of one Valet who wouldn't look me in the eye or speak to me when I requested my car) were all professional, friendly and sincere. The hotel offered a complimentary breakfast in the mornings, but I was not able to partake. It did look bountiful when I rushed past every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Very Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: shellbeeTampaFlorida
Reviews.Content: Just a quick walk to the River Walk for shopping, dining and river cruise, Casino, and Cable Cars. Very nice long walk to French Quarter but we love to walk. Secure parking, very freindly staff. Great breakfast included in price. I really enjoyed this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Taralise
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! It was very clean and the staff was nice. The rooms were great! We had a basic room, but it even came with a neat little kitchen-esque area that had a sink, fridge, dishes, microwave, counter and cabinets, etc. It also had a little couch and desk. TV was a big CRT that wasn't positioned well in relation to the bed, but it worked out okay. The bed was huge and comfy. The location was kind of on the edge of the quarter area, so it was very convenient - you could either get in quickly or avoid it entirely. Also, the Hertz rental car place was very close. Being that it is in the business district there weren't tons of people just walking around all the time, which was uncommonly nice in this part of town. The value was great! It was the best hotel for the money in the area. They had free continental breakfast in the mornings that was good and sometimes cookies in the lobby. They have valet parking, but it costs extra - you are kind of forced into it because there is nowhere else to park anyway. But is still reasonable when considered with the cost of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: NaomOttawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel, in the warehouse district of New Orleans, offers wonderful "suite" accommodation at reasonable prices in a converted cotton warehouse (ask for that building - there is also a more modern addition with nice rooms, which we have also stayed at). High ceilings, a nicely furnished small kitchen and table for two, exposed brick wall, huge windows. Bed and bedding were clean and very good quality. We faced the park on St. Peter's Street, so we are not sure if the other side of the building, which is close to the I-10, would be noisy. Breakfasts, as usual for the Hampton Inn, were included in the price, and pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the ambience,location,and staff of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jinxs18
Reviews.Content: We got in really late,prior to a cruise sailing and the staff helped get all 8 of us settled ,including a 5mos old baby! They couldn't have been nicer!! Even made sure we got a special shuttle buss to the ship-which by the way we could see from our hotel room!! That just added to the start of a great vacation. I would stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Boefters
Reviews.Content: Great large suites with kitchens. Friendly and helpful staff. We loved our room. Very big, huge bed, nice little kitchen, big bathroom, very large windows and good housekeeping. The breakfast isn't bad either, and is included in the price. Quite central, downtown is only 5 minutes walk away, or a short cab ride. I will stay there again when I am back in the city.

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: catbeckster
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good to say about this hotel. We just got back from a cruise and this Hampton Inn made it "smooth sailin". Yeah, that is corny but the truth! The hotel itself is beautiful, the rooms are immaculate. We did a cruise and park package. The parking garage is totally secure. I did not have a second thought about leaving anything in the car. They delivered us to the terminal and were there to pick us up. We got back to the hotel and honestly, we were in our car, fully loaded and on the way in 5 minutes. The staff was awesome. The night we came in, the bellman asked me several times if I needed anything. French Quarter is within walking distance IF you want to walk. We took a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: sk84fungirl
Reviews.Content: I checked into Hampton Inn on Friday, 7/30 for a convention. The hotel does not have an airpoort shuttle, so we used other transportation. We were a part of 15K visiting N.O. for a convention. Check in was quick and the staff was awesome. I wish I could remember the name of the gentleman that checked me in as he was wonderful. The hotel is very quaint and was clean when we entered. The rooms and lobby areas remained clear our entire stay. We had some very minor challenges with housekeeping, but nothing that would keep us from returning or detailing here. The daily breakfast was actually quite good. I was not expecting much and was surprised in the daily variety of foods. The hotel is DIRECTLY across from Hall E of the convention center and easily accessible by foot or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Convention Center only”
Reviews.Author: Hotelsnob1997
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, my room was really cold and even when I tried to adjust the temperature it stayed the same. I didn't complain to the front desk though because I didn't mind it being cold, since it was 100 outside! There was also a really weird smell in the room , I couldn't pin point it, it was musty, moldy or maybe smoke but I was in a non-smoking room and I was on the 6th floor so it wasn't becasue I was in a basement. either...I did call the hotel and they assured me that it was a non-smoking room and they could send somebody up to see what the smell was, but I thought I was being picky so I declined. Overall, the hotel was nice and clean, the people at the front desk were really nice and helpful too. The location is bad if you want to do any sightseeing. It's too far to walk to Bourbon Street and any other attraction, you will spend a lot of money on cabs. But I was there for a conference and it's a great location for that. All I had to do was walk across the street. I switched hotels for the weekend so I could be closer to the attractions, I would recommend doing that if you want to enjoy New Orleans at night. Also, there are no hotel shuttles anywhere, so when I needed a cab to get to my other hotel, they charged us a flat fee of $10, I think that's what it was, even though it would have been cheaper if I had them drop me off at the restaurant next door, then it would have only cost $5. I didn't use the pool, but I walked over to it and it was very small..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as usual, super convenient location, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: DonH
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and is across the street from the convention center, which makes it a really convenient location. Everything was excellent, as I have come to expect from Hampton Inn. The staff was friendly, the room clean, the Wi-Fi worked well, and the breakfast was great. What's not to like? Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conv.Center Location - Great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: cowmoo123
Reviews.Content: Right across from the Convention Center...rooms are comfortable, the bed and pillows especially...ours also had a mini fridge and microwave. We were upgraded to a suite in the warehouse side after a plumbing problem in our original room. Staff have all been very friendly and helpful. Hot buffet breakfast a big plus as there is no place to have breakfast within a reasonable walking distance. Sundry shop is also convenient for snacks and miscellaneous. No restaurant. Pool is small but nice touches with towels and ice water readily available.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need dehumidifiers”
Reviews.Author: psychtobe
Reviews.Content: The Convention Center Hampton Inn is directly across from the Convention Center itself - in fact it is the closest hotel, which is why we selected it. It is a bit of a walk from the French quarter, probably about 15-20 minutes. It is great if you plan to spend most of your time at your meeting, otherwise I'd choose another location. Nearby are a few up and coming and established restaurants, but there isn't the density of Canal Street and the French Quarter. The hotel is in an old Cotton mill, historic brick building on the outside. The lobby and common areas are clean, appropriate for the hotel quality, not overwhelming or overly impressive. The staff was helpful - brought an extra toothbrush on request, helped out with running route suggestions, explained how to use the streetcars, and arranged a tax for 4:30 in the morning - they did a nice job. The room was standard Hampton Inn. CRTV, no flat-screen. No safe in the room. Standard HI bathroom, perfectly serviceable, clean and white, nothing objectionable at all. The beds (we had a 2 double bed room) were very comfortable, and clean. The room was quiet to noise from the outside. Our only complaint, and it is a significant one, is that the climate control system was poor. During the hot and humid weather we had (isn't it always hot and humid in New Orleans?), the room was constantly muggy, no matter how high we cranked up the AC. It wasn't hot in the room - the AC made it downright cold. It's just that there was constant humidity in the room. At night, even though I was cool/cold, I found myself sweating under the sheets because of the humidity. Also, the AC unit was extremely noisy. With the unit off, the TV was easily heard on volume 10. With the unit on, the TV could not be heard until the volume was at 35-40 or higher. Since it is New Orleans, and always hot, the room was noisy almost continuously. The breakfast was standard Hampton Inn - hardboiled eggs, an omelet choice, a potato choice, fresh waffles, cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, coffee, juice. It's a pretty nice breakfast, though not fancy. I thought the price was about right - not a steal - for the quality of the hotel. Again, the location is plus/minus - close to the conference, but definitely farther from the 'action' and most of the restaurants. The walk really isn't bad, though, and you are closer to the St. Charles Ave streetcar from this hotel than if you stayed nearer the French Quarter. Overall we'd stay here again, but only if we could be assured of either a quieter AC or a better dehumidifying unit. Otherwise we'd choose somewhere else, as it just made for some uncomfortable nights sleeping. I should mention that we never asked the management for a different room or a different unit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: SuziQWorcestershire
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely 2 night stay at this hotel. On a coach tour, otherwise would have been happier to stay longer. Lovely building (converted warehouse). Very nice room and the free coffee just off reception a nice, welcoming touch. The complementary cookies on reception in the evening also a nice touch. Breakfast included in the price. The only downside was that it is not located near to the French Quarter but trolley stop close by (no timetable on stop and we started walking after a wait of about 10 mins and not really sure whether it was still running, but then noticed it coming along the tracks and able to jump on). We walked back as it was not too late in the evening but had been advised not to do this later on. New Orleans a fabulous place and well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, but overpriced with critters”
Reviews.Author: FunkyMan3333
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is nice enough, and in a very convenient location (immediately across the street from the convention center, I was disappointed with my experience. Part of the disappointment stems from the price paid ($260/night) which was obviously hiked due to the large meeting I attended. I understand that logic, but this hotel is not worth $260/night. The standard $100-150 per night is more like it. The rooms were clean, and of standard Holiday Inn quality. Wi-fi in all the rooms was very convenient, although speed and consistency was not optimal. Unfortunately, a large cockroach on my bed one morning ruined part of my experience. The weather had changed (with lots of rain), and I know southern cities have cockroach problems in hotels, but I don't expect this from a Hampton Inn. The management was very responsive, and gave me the night free - they were very apologetic and said they hadn't seen one in 'months'. They apparently cleaned the room top-to-bottom and sprayed (with non-odorous pesticide). They also said they planned to get pest control in that part of the hotel as soon as we left. I was generally happy with my quality of sleep, and convenience prompted me to stay. The free breakfast buffet was outstanding, and the lobby was very nice. Still, I'm not sure I would stay here again (unless the price is halved, and the pest problem is solved).

Reviews.Title: “First Hampton Inn experience was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie723
Reviews.Content: I love coming to New Orleans and always try to stay at the amazing, historic hotels, however, the city was sold out for Jazzfest and the only place open was this Hampton Inn. I was not disappointed! The lobby in the reclaimed warehouse building is lovely, the rooms were standard, but spacious and clean (I was in the newer building). Very comfortable beds, fast & free wifi, soft towels, great (but small) pool area and a nice gym with plenty of equipment, fresh towels and ice water. Everything was extremely well-maintained. The breakfast area was constantly refreshed and kept nice and tidy by the attentive staff. In fact, the entire staff at the hotel was fantastic -- very helpful and friendly. We got in at 9am and were able to check right in to our rooms. Also enjoyed the 2-for-1 drink coupons! We didn't mind the walk into the quarter, but it is kind of a trek, depending on where you are heading. Perfect for convention-goers, though. Plenty of bars nearby, too.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hampton Inn we've found”
Reviews.Author: llr43
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a beautifully restored production warehouse across the street from the convention center. Not restored to the elegance of the Molino Stuckey Hilton in Venice, but the inside uses original wood floors and ceilings. The breakfast dining room was large and there was plenty of food for this size property. The hotel has a small indoor bar with space outside around the pool. Service from desk, bell staff, car retrieval was superior. When our luggage was picked up from the 4th floor room, by the time we arrived outside, the car was waiting. It's a long walk to the French Quarter, so we walked 5 minutes to the Julia St. Trolley and rode to the 8 riverfront stops. Cost, $1.25 per person, correct change. We'd return to this hotel and its lower rates and take the trolley or a cab to dinner and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stafy Pre/Post Criuise- amazing service!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rskny1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family before a cruise & had a great experience. They provide shuttle service to the dock, and even stored our luggae on the way home!!!! The staff was outstanding. Gina at check in went out of her way to resolve an issue , and Christopher was always extremley helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding convention center hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelrockstexas
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to New Orleans for a convention and had the pleasure of staying at the Hampton Inn and Suites Convention Center. The property is in a renovated warehouse and has preserved many of the charming interior designs while maintaining a fresh and bright appearance. My spouse joined for the weekend and also enjoyed his stay. Personnel at check-in were competent and friendly. The room was clean and spacious. The breakfast was a great spread of hot and cold items - definitely plenty to get you going for an early morning meeting and keep you full through lunch. 24-hour coffee, tea, and fruit was a very nice touch. There's even freshly-baked cookies in the evening! Of the many convention hotels we have stayed at, this one seemed to have more amenities than the rest - all for a very reasonable price. Location directly across from the Convention Center can't be beat. Made it very easy to come back and forth between meetings. French Quarter is an easy walk or streetcar ride. Many dining options (Cochon, Mother's, Riverwalk Food court) are all within walking distance. At night, we cabbed to Canal St, etc for around $10. Free WiFi everywhere and a business center where you can print out boarding passes, etc for free. Would definitely stay here again! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Nice”
Reviews.Author: msirene
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn was very nice and clean. It is walking distance from the River Walk and the room we stayed in had a good view of the Convention Center. The front desk staff was very friendly and eager to help. We stayed at the Hampton Inn during the summer so the kids enjoyed the swimming pool which was in an indoor courtyard inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....”
Reviews.Author: GoldenBoy09
Reviews.Content: Took a group of 24 guys to N.O. for the Saint's Monday nighter. We stayed here for 4 nights. Excellent hotel, all staff, rooms, breakfast, everything "A-1". Walking distance to Bourbon Street and lots more. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Non smoking room IS NOT”
Reviews.Author: lukcan
Reviews.Content: I have requested a non-smoking room with my reservation and repeated my request as I checked in. I was told that the room was non-smoking but as I entered the room it was clear that it was not (the smell! and the headache it followed.). When I confronted the front desk again they stated that they were completely sold out and that they will give a ozone generator. Obviously, I am looking for a room in town to move but Hampton Inn is no longer my destination. If you can tolerate the smell or you are a smoker the room is clean, spacious and comfortable and just across the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: LBW88
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in quite a few Hampton Inns and I have to say that this hotel is the best one by far! The staff was very friendly and helpful. From the moment I walked in the lobby, I was impressed. The room exceeded my expectations! It was very spacious, clean and I loved the exposed brick walls and high ceiling. The only thing I didn't care for was the fact that it is a little farther from the French Quarter than I like when I am staying in New Orleans, but it was not too far from the trolly that takes you into the Quarter. I would definately stay in this Hampton again....

Reviews.Title: “Should at Least be a 3 Star Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler2979
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn during the Esence Music Festival 2009 and I have no complaints. Everything was above satisfactory and will stay here again the next time i'm visiting N.O.! The rooms were clean, well stocked, not overly spacious but definitely adequate sized, and the free breakfast was great. The hotel offered access to the business center and provided baggage storage which was much needed, given that my flight wasn't until 7pm. One last thing, the location is in walking distance to the convention center, mall, and restaurants which was also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: jtstravelNewYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during the SHRM 09 Conference. Hotel is excellent - 1/4 block from the Convention Center. Rooms are large, clean, lobby is large, comfortable, breakfast was wonderful at 6 am and at 10 am - hostesses were polite and constantly cleaning and restocking. Christopher at the front desk was full of information about New Orleans and tips for our sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: grobma
Reviews.Content: This is an unusual Hampton Inn both in terms of size (it's quite large) and the fact that it is in an old warehouse. I did not stay on the warehouse side, but in the Riverside building facing the convention center. I heard from colleagues that the rooms in the warehouse building were larger (my "King Study" was smallish). Breakfast and bar areas are spacious and well-decorated. Staff was very friendly. Wish there was a phone on the desk in my room, but at least the one by the bed had a long cord so I ould move it to the desk. My very basic room did have a microwave and small refrigerator. The location is the big selling point of this property as it is directly across from the convention center. It is about a 10 minute walk to Harrah's Casino which is about half-way to the French Quarter. Riverwalk is very close and as it is on the edge of the CBD, some funky restaurants are nearby. I was there for the beginning of Bike Week (think Harley-Davidson, not Schwinn) and as I was coming back one night there was a very loud outdoor concert taking place just a block away. I was concerned about being kept awake, but my room was perfectly quiet. One big plus - the HVAC unit kept an amazingly constant temperature and WITHOUT the clunking noise many make when the A/C compressor kicks in. It was quiet and comfortable 24/7. One big minus - water pressure in the shower is not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hampton Inn experience”
Reviews.Author: SECfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Convention Center for the 2009 Sugar Bowl as part of the halftime entertainers which was made up of 160 high school dancers and chaperones. Most hotels are less than thrilled when you arrive with an army of teenagers, but the staff at the Hampton was absolutely wonderful. They could not have been more accommodating. The hotel is lovely; both public areas and rooms are clean and comfortable. I really cannot say enough about the staff and how well we were treated. We will definitely stay at this Hampton on our next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gypsypam
Reviews.Content: I am shocked that this hotel only has a 2 star rating. I travel quite a bit and this does not seem on par with 2 stars. I really enjoyed this hotel. It should have a higher rating. The rooms are clean and very well attended. The lobby has wonderful little touches such as fresh flowers and at 5pm warm cookies. They have a delightful breakfast buffet so much better then other chain hotels. Warm food and all. We stayed there for 2 weeks and the hotel staff was always friendly and kind. Our 6 yr old boy says this hotel is so good, he loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A nice Hampton”
Reviews.Author: apsara711
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely Hampton Inn. Very gracious service. Very convenient location to the convention center. About a 20 minute walk from the heart of the French Quarter. Don't miss Tommy's Cuisine just a few blocks away. Fantastic food, great atmosphere, and superb service. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a lot of character”
Reviews.Author: MELISSA K
Reviews.Content: A large group of us stayed here for a International Jazzercise convention. The breakfasts were above average for a hotel chain and the coffee was great! The pool was small but nice with water and ice available. The cleanliness of our room was not up to our standards the first night and it was addressed immediately and was clean for the rest of our stay. The character because of the decor of the hotel is very different and gives it a lot of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddict1001
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with comfy beds and a free continental breakfast that was very nice (hot foods, bagels, fruit, cereal, french toast...etc). The rooms were clean and it was quiet. Our room had a fridge and microwave. The hotel has a a little market with ice cream, lean cuisines, pop, etc... overpriced food, but it was convenient when arriving late from the airport. They also have complimentary cookies and coffee in the evenings. The Warehouse Deli they advertise has been closed since Katrina. There is a simple bar/restaurant, Dino's, a block away that had good food for lunch. There is a mini-mart about 10 minutes walk to buy popcorn, snacks, drinks, etc at somewhat more reasonable prices. This is an excellent location for those attending conferences at the convention center. It is a 15 minute (easy/flat) walk to the Hilton Riverside, The Riverwalk Mall, Harrah's, Canal Street, etc. It's also about a 15 minute walk to the St. Charles Streetcar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NJJoyful
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while my husband attended the ASCD conference. We asked for a room with a pullout bed for our daughter and we received an amazing suite. The room was lovely, the maids were so friendly and responsive to our requests. The front desk staff were so helpful with info on public transportation, restaurants,etc. The convention center was right across the street, the streetcar was a short walk, and our area of town was quiet and pretty, right across from the river. Add to that breakfast provided every morning, included in the room price, and a gorgeous lobby, workout room and washing machines available for guests, and we really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: beachseekers
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 weeks - Xmas and New Years. Wonderful,quiet, location in Warehouse District which we might have not explored so thouroghly if this wasnt the only hotel I could find last minute! (Sugarbowl? What Sugarbowl...) Nice & helpful staff and check out Dino's Bar & Grill down the street. 20 minute safe walk to Jackson Square, French Quarter (day or nite) or Superdome (day only). Not your average Hampton as it truly is in a renovated warhouse. Give it a try if you want something not inside FQ crazy, but close enuf to hoof it to the FQ action

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and amazingly quiet hotel...”
Reviews.Author: SheWhoWanders
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel - we spent New Year's Eve at the hotel (which was also the night before the Sugar Bowl in New Orleans). The hotel was at 100% capacity and they still functioned effectively and it was amazingly quiet due to the festivities. The location is across the street from the convention center and a short walk (15 minutes) through the Warehouse district to the French Quarter. There were restaurants and bars within easy walks (a few blocks) - the negihborhood felt safe. Our room was clean and well kept, but obviously someone had been smoking in it (even though it was a non-smoking room). The front desk staff were very friendly and there was a very nice free continental breakfast. The only negative was the parking fees - valet only at over $25 a night (I think it was $28?). Although, there was a flat lot (privately run) behind the hotel that we were able to self-park for $15 a night. I would definitely stay here again - great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaHerb
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel Attended a seminar in June. Lobby, breakfast, room, facilities and service were perfect in every way. A great attention to detail by the staff in a very warm and inviting envirnoment. Right across the street from the Convention Center and a block from Expressway. Not far from the French Quarter. A great spot for everyone. I got a great rate which was the icing on the cake but would have been happy paying much more.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Stay”
Reviews.Author: SunitaVancouver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn while attending a conference in New Orleans in October. The hotel is a renovated warehouse with sky-high ceilings, beautiful antique furniture and lush tropical plants. The interior designers and architects have pulled off a tricky job: they have managed to create an impressive, dignified lobby that is also warm and inviting. My room was extremely comfortable and clean, with all the usual luxurious amenities (a firm bed, lots of fluffy pillows, fragrant toiletries, thick towels, etc.). My stay at the Hampton Inn was especially pleasant for two reasons. First, buffet breakfast and dinner were provided with the room rate. The night I had dinner at the hotel, the buffet menu included creole shrimp, creamy potato-leek soup, salad and the most delicious brownies I have ever had. Breakfast was equally good: a spread of cereals, pastries, fruit and hot food. Second, the staff at the Hampton Inn are to be commended for their warmth and hospitality. My luggage did not arrive with me but the front desk, once alerted of this, provided me with additional toiletries and brought my bag up to my room as soon it arrived at midnight. Christopher at the front desk was efficient as well as informative and had a fount of stories about his roots in Lousiana (ask him about his pet snake!). The location of the hotel is ideal for convention-goers, though the area around the convention center was almost eerily quiet (people still haven't returned to New Orleans, unfortunately). There were few shops and restaurants open. The French Quarter is about a six or seven-minute cab ride away. In any other city, that would be a walkable distance but the weather in New Orleans, even in October, was unbearably hot and humid (and I say this as someone who grew up in a tropical country). Also, I was constantly advised by the natives to take cabs rather than walk. I am not sure if this is because I was there as a single female, or if the city is still relatively unsafe, or some combination of the two. Cabs are relatively cheap, but not always easy to come by -- once again, because of the lack of tourists. It might be an idea to have the phone number of a cab company handy. All in all, I was touched by the kindness and friendliness of the people in New Orleans and would love to stay at the Hampton Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good value, nice rooms, a few Katrina related problems”
Reviews.Author: labber
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for Jazzfest. It was not my first choice. I had initially reserved a room at a diff Hampton Inn that is closer to the French Quarter. A couple weeks before my arrival, I was informed that they could not honor my reservation becuase people who were staying to help with Hurricane work had extended their stay. As a result, Hampton unilaterally decided to switch me to their place at the Convention Center. Hampton allowed the same rate, and included dinner as well as breakfast. There was some initial confusion about this change, and I had some difficulty getting a written confirmation. However, after faxing them about the problem, I promptly got a written confirmation of all the changes. The hotel facilities are very nice. It is a renovated warehouse, so you have a sort of "loft" feeling. The decor is lovely, and everything was very clean. The location would be perfect for future convention goers - it is directly across the street from the convention center. The CC is cleaned up outside, though not yet opened. Location was also good for attending jazzfest, because shuttle buses left for the fairgrounds from the convention center. As reported about other NOLA hotels at this time, they appeared to be short of staff. We were advised on check in that rooms would only be serviced every other day -- though you could call for extra towels and other supplies. Given the circumstances in NOLA, I did not think this was unreasonable. It was obvious that staff was doing a very good job of keeping all the public areas spotless. Also could not locate any valet parking attendants when I checked in, so I did self parking which was convenient enough. There was a notice in our room that effective May 1, they were switching parking areas to a lot about a block away. I did not see that lot, so I can't say how safe or convenient that would be. The hotel is located in the warehouse district of town. There did not appear to be much hurricane related damage in the area. However, a lot of the restaurants and clubs in the area are closed, due to lack of staff and/or lack of tourists and others. Emirils restaurant is just a couple blocks away, and other interesting places are close by. It is a bit of a hike to the French Quarter, probably about 15-20 minutes. At present there is no complimentary shuttle from the hotel to the FQ. A cab to Bourbon Street cost about $6 Breakfast was standard Hampton fare - breads, bagels, danish, eggs and one other hot dish, fruits, juices, cereals. There hotel also served a complimentary dinner. Check to be sure this is included in your rate. It is not included in all rates, because they would check your room number before allowing you into the area. It is a buffet that is catered by the Convention Center catering company. (Seemed to be set up for people who were doing work restoring the convention center who were staying at the hotel.) The dinners were a nice buffet. Steak and Mahi Mahi one night. Veal and Pork another night. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and welcoming. They were very glad to have people there, and let you know how happy they were to see you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TU94
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at this hotel during the Essence Festival - 4th of July weekend. This hotel was awesome. It is a newer hotel in an old warehouse. The staff there was incredible. We had no issues during checkin/out. The bellmen met you at the curb to bring up your bags and even offered to fill your ice bucket! There is a nice continental breakfast served each morning. The beds were very comfortable. I have stayed at several New Orleans hotels and this is one of the best. It is right across from the convention center so it's a walk to the french quarter. Not a horribly long walk but I wouldn't put on the heels! The guys in valet are great and it's a very short wait to retrieve your car or have it parked. As we were leaving one of the valet guys even offered to fill our cooler with ice as we were leaving. If you are going to New Orleans and there are events/activities at the convention center this is definitely the place to stay. The service and cleanliness also makes it a good choice if you don't mind driving to get to the french quarter area.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Hampton”
Reviews.Author: Gussy
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this property. Was concerned that it was out of the way; however, it was a nice walk along the riverfront and not far from the French Quarter. Rode the streetcar once to the FQ; however, after eating all the great food we decided we needed to walk! There is an adequate breakfast in the morning and the rooms were clean. Would stay here again whether it's to catch a cruise, attend a convention, or party with friends for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Unusually Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dave1013
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in February 2005. As the Airport Shuttle dropped us off, my first impression of the building was, well, not positive. It looked like we were walking into a dilapidated warehouse. As I soon found out, that is by design and my first impression quickly changed into one of delight. As a previous reviewer aptly noted, this is not your typical Hampton Inn. Part of the hotel is a thoroughly renovated cotton mill/department store warehouse. Luckily, I got to stay in the renovated section by virtue of my Gold Hilton HHonors status. My room was wonderful - large, high-ceiling, clean and comfortable. High, comfortable, four-poster bed. Upscale wood furniture. Fridge and microwave provided. The old windows and brickwork on the exterior wall were preserved, adding to the vintage flavor of the facility. The lobby had what appeared to be original hardwood flooring, which had been excellently restored. It was evident that Hampton had put a lot of money into the renovation - the interior, at least. They seemingly did nothing to the exterior of the building but then again, you don't stay outside. There is complimentary wireless internet access in the room, and laundry facilities (dollar each to wash and dry) and an exercise room in the basement. The morning breakfast was adequate and the staff was helpful. I am coming back here in May and am already looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DixieSheri
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff that aim to please. Great breakfast. Rooms were clean and we had plenty of space. Location is perfect for convention goers or just short walk to public transportation and Riverwalk. Enjoyed our stay, but next time were staying in the French Quarter!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hampton, great decor, clean rooms and yummy breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: MSFishGirl
Reviews.Content: Just got back from New Orleans, sin city, and had an absolute blast. Prior to our mini vacation I did a lot of hotel searching on TripAdvisor for a nice hotel under $100 close to the action of the French Quarter. Thankfully we found the Hampton Inn and Suites-Convention Center. The hotel is fairly new with beautiful decor. The lobby was huge, full of big comfy chairs and couches. SO comfy in fact, we found 2 hotel guests sleeping on them at 1 am. Must have had a little too much fun on Bourbon Street!!! We reserved 2 rooms each with 2 double beds. We ended up getting two rooms both handicapped accessible, but one room was upgraded to a HUGE suite for the same price. We surely didn't mind. The room decor was cozy and colorful. These rooms were a steal at $98 with AAA. We were also within walking distance to downtown (~1 mile), but far enough to get some sleep. We had no problems with parking and had 2 cars to valet. Oh...and the valet guys were awesome. Also, we loved the breakfast which was included in the room rate. It was a full breakfast with eggs, sauage, muffins, etc. Everything was warm and yummy thanks to the 3 employees that kept an eye on everything. Overall, we had a great experience at the Hampton and would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel, but a Bit Way”
Reviews.Author: SavannahSweets
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. They have a wonderful breakfast. I find it rare that hotels offer 5-6 different types of juices, 2 %, low fat, whole milk and any other type of beverages one can imagine. Each morning there was a wide range each of : fresh fruit, pastry, breads, cereals, grits, pan cakes, waffle, you name it they had it, all except meats. My husband was told that they expect to add breakfast meats in the next few months. Our room was on the fourth floor. We had a fridge and microwave. The view wasn't much but the room was comfortable with a hugh Rice Bed and a sleeper couch. The #3 View Carre, a small bus which travels to the French Quaters dropped us off near the hotel and picked up up across the street atn the convention center. The staff did not have knowledge of transit passes or the routes of the buses which passes the hotel. Transit passes can be purchased in the River Walk Mall at a small store. The cost was $5.00 for 1 day and 12.00 for 3 days of unlimited transit usage. I would have rated this hotel excellent but, the staff should be a bit more knowledgeable of the transit system, since the #3 goes of duty at 7:10 p.m. Each night my husband and I walked several blocks to get back to the hotel. This hotel is in the warehouse district; I would not walk thru this area alone! Billy, who works the front desk goes beyond the call of duty to help those who are staying at this site. Another asset is the breakfast hostess.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hampton Inn Convention Center five or six times over the course of the last 6 or 7 weeks. I love it. The rates are reasonable and it is well within walking distance to the Quarter and other attractions.The service is great and everyone from the front desk to the valet parking attendants are very friendly.I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance at the Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value. It is close enough to the French Quarter to walk or take the streetcar or shuttle, but far enough away to be quiet at night. The buffet is great and the lobby has oldworld charm. Definitely not your run-of-the-mill Hampton Inn.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn & Suites Convention Center
HotelInfo.Address: 1201 Convention Center Boulevard, New Orleans, LA 70130
